problem.markdown:
A milling machine is used to do an operation on a certain part. The operation time is 2 minutes. On the average,the machine requires maintenance after operating on 3,000 parts. The average time for maintenance is 7 hours. (For the purpose of these calculations, maintenance is the same as a failure.)
>>How many hours are needed to produce 24,000 parts if that is the only operation needed for that part? Round to nearest integer.<<
= 856 +-2
[explanation] MTTF=(3000 parts) x (2 minutes/part) = 6000 minutes = 100 hours MTTR=7 hours \(\tau\) = 2 minutes Production rate = \( \frac{1}{\tau}(\frac{MTTF}{MTTF+MTTR})=\frac{1}{2}\frac{100}{100+7}=0.467\) parts per minute Time to make 24,000 parts is \(24000/.467=51360\) minutes or 856 hours [explanation]
